title: Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO Allotment Finalised: GMP At 61.38%, A Step-By-Step Guide To Check Allotment Sta - News18
summary:
Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO Allotment Finalised: GMP At 61.38%

Date & Source: December 26, 2024, 18:19 IST

The allotment of the Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO has been finalised with a strong grey market premium (GMP) of 61.38%, indicating a successful listing expected on December 30.

  • The IPO was oversubscribed by 97.86 times overall.
  • Retail investors subscribed 93.16 times, and NII portion saw 100.35 times subscription.
  • The shares are currently trading at Rs 631 in the grey market, significantly above the issue price of Rs 391.
  • The IPO consists of fresh issuance worth Rs 500 crore and an OFS of up to 21 lakh shares.
“Grey market premium indicates investors’ readiness to pay more than the issue price.”

The IPO proceeds will support manufacturing expansions and working capital needs, as well as general corporate purposes.
newTitle: Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO Allotment Finalised with GMP at 61.38%

title: SC allows banks to charge 30% interest rates on credit card dues - The Times of India
summary:
SC Allows Banks to Charge 30% Interest Rates on Credit Card Dues

Publication Date: Recent | Source: Times of India

The Supreme Court has approved a regulation allowing banks to charge a maximum annual interest rate of 30% on credit card dues, stating that such rates are reasonable under current economic conditions.

  • The decision aligns with the banking sector's need to manage risks associated with credit.
  • The ruling emphasizes the importance of credit card usage in the modern consumer economy.
  • Consumer protection measures and transparency in fee disclosures were also highlighted.
"This decision is crucial for maintaining the balance between consumer protection and the financial stability of banks," the Supreme Court stated.

This ruling is expected to shape the future of credit card policies in India, ensuring that banks can sustain themselves while not overburdening consumers.
newTitle: SC Allows Banks to Charge 30% Interest Rates on Credit Card Dues

title: Bad loans decline: Banks’ gross NPA ratio declines to over 13-year low of 2.5% as at end September, says RBI report - The Indian Express
summary:
Banks' Gross NPA Ratio Hits 13-Year Low at 2.5%: RBI Report

Publication Date: October 2024 | Source: Indian Express

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) reports that the gross non-performing assets (GNPAs) ratio of scheduled commercial banks has decreased to 2.5%, marking the lowest level in over 13 years as of September 2024.

  • The GNPAs fell from 2.7% at the end of March 2024 to 2.5% in September 2024.
  • The agricultural sector records the highest GNPA ratio at 6.2% while retail loans show the lowest at 1.2%.
  • GNPA for education loans decreased to 2.7% from 5.8% at end-March 2023.
  • Banks' net NPA (NNPA) ratio reached a decade low of 0.57% as of September 2024.
  • The slippage ratio improved for banks for the third consecutive year.
“Asset quality improved, with the GNPA ratio falling to its lowest in 13 years at 2.5%,” stated the RBI report.

This improvement in asset quality is attributed to better recoveries and upgrades in the banking sector.
newTitle: Banks' Gross NPA Ratio Hits 13-Year Low at 2.5%: RBI Report

Setback for Rashmi Saluja, Burmans as court stays Religare’s AGM and RBI’s approval for open offer | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Setback for Burmans as court stays Religare’s AGM, RBI’s approval for open offer

Publication Date: 18 December 2023

Source: Live Mint

The Madhya Pradesh High Court has stayed Religare Enterprises Ltd's annual general meeting scheduled for 31 December and the Reserve Bank of India's approval for the Burman family to make an open offer for 26% additional stake in REL.

This decision comes amidst disputes regarding minority shareholder interests amidst the Burman family's attempts to increase their stake.

  • The court's order followed a public interest litigation aimed at protecting minority shareholders.
  • 73,263 shareholders holding up to ₹2 lakh worth of REL stock could face adverse effects.
  • The Burman family aims to oust chairperson Rashmi Saluja.
  • The court has issued notices to involved parties and scheduled a further hearing for 17 January.
“We request the court to set up an independent commission of enquiry to oversee and monitor the proposed acquisition.” - Vijayant Mishra

This ruling underscores the ongoing tensions between Religare and the Burmans, impacting future governance and stakeholder interests.
newTitle: Setback for Burmans as court stays Religare’s AGM, RBI’s approval for open offer

title: Upcoming IPO: Ashish Kacholia-backed Sri Lotus Developers and Realty files DRHP with SEBI to raise ₹792 crore via IPO | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Sri Lotus Developers Files IPO to Raise ₹792 Crore

Date: December 26, 2023 Source: Live Mint

Mumbai-based real estate developer Sri Lotus Developers Limited has filed a draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with SEBI, aiming to raise approximately ₹792 crore through its upcoming IPO.

  • The company will issue new equity shares with a face value of ₹1 each.
  • No offer-for-sale component is included in the public issue.
  • The funds will be allocated to subsidiaries for ongoing project development.
  • Sri Lotus has a portfolio of over 7 million sqft of projects since its founding in 2015.
  • The company's net profits were ₹90.6 crore for Q2 of FY 2024-25.
"The key risk for the company is location exposure, as it focuses solely on the Western Suburbs of Mumbai."

This IPO represents a significant opportunity for the company to bolster its financial standing and support ongoing projects in a competitive real estate market.
newTitle: Sri Lotus Developers Files IPO to Raise ₹792 Crore

title: N Chandrasekaran’s year-end note: Tribute to Ratan Tata and a vision for 500,000 jobs in next 5 years | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
N Chandrasekaran’s year-end note: Tribute to Ratan Tata and a vision for 500,000 jobs in next 5 years

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

N Chandrasekaran, Chairman of Tata Group, posts a year-end message paying tribute to Ratan Tata and announcing the creation of 500,000 jobs in the next five years.

  • Chandrasekaran reflects on global humanitarian crises linked to recent geopolitical upheavals.
  • He praises Ratan Tata as a role model and mentor whose vision shaped the Tata Group.
  • The aim is to create jobs across manufacturing sectors, including semiconductors, electric vehicles, and solar equipment.
  • Chandrasekaran emphasizes India's potential in a new technological age, especially with its young talent.
  • He expresses optimism about India's economic prospects in the coming year.
“Progress holds little value if it doesn’t enhance human well-being.” - N Chandrasekaran

Chandrasekaran’s focus on new job creation along with a tribute to Ratan Tata solidifies Tata Group’s commitment to India's future.

summary:
Mamata Machinery and DAM Capital Advisors Lead New IPO Listings This Friday

Date: Not specified Source: Economic Times

Six companies, including Mamata Machinery and DAM Capital Advisors, will list their shares on Friday, following successful IPOs.

  • Mamata Machinery has a great Grey Market Premium (GMP) of Rs 245, representing over 100% increase from its issue price of Rs 243.
  • DAM Capital Advisors is trading at a GMP of 51%.
  • The IPO of Mamata Machinery was massively subscribed, achieving 194 times oversubscription.
  • Other companies listing include Transrail Lighting, Concord Enviro Systems, and Sanathan Textiles, with various GMPs.
  • The IPOs are entirely Offers for Sale (OFS) by selling shareholders, meaning proceeds do not go to the company.
“The public offer of DAM Capital was subscribed 82 times.”

Overall, the IPO activity in India is expected to continue strongly, with fundraising projected to exceed Rs 2 lakh crore through 2025.
newTitle: Mamata Machinery and DAM Capital Advisors Lead New IPO Listings This Friday

title: Economic growth seen at 6.5% in FY25, RBI policy pushed down demand: FinMin - Business Standard
summary:
Economic growth seen at 6.5% in FY25, RBI policy pushed down demand: FinMin

Publication Date: November 2024

Source: Finance Ministry's Monthly Economic Review

The Centre expects the economy to grow at 6.5% in FY25 after a dull first half, influenced by agricultural and industrial activities, despite challenges posed by the RBI's monetary policy.

  • The GDP growth rate fell to a seven-quarter low of 5.4% in July-September 2024.
  • The RBI has kept key rates unchanged for 11 consecutive meetings.
  • The Finance Ministry attributes demand slowdown to monetary policy and structural factors.
  • Positive impact noted from lowering of the cash reserve ratio (CRR) by the RBI.
  • Growth outlook for the next quarter appears bright with resilient rural demand.
  • Urban demand is improving, indicated by significant growth in passenger vehicle sales.
“That should help boost credit growth, which has slowed a little too much and quickly in FY25.”

The Finance Ministry remains optimistic about economic recovery in the second half of FY25, supported by increased government expenditure and resilient domestic demand.
newTitle: Economic Growth Projected at 6.5% for FY25 Amid Demand Challenges

title: Indian banks' balance sheets stay robust, bad loans decline more: RBI report - The Economic Times
summary:
Indian banks' balance sheets stay robust, bad loans decline more: RBI report

Publication Date: Thursday

Source: Reserve Bank of India

Indian banks have shown continued strength in their financial positions, with a significant reduction in bad loans and sustained growth in both loans and deposits.

  • The gross bad loan ratio has decreased to 2.5%, the lowest in over 13 years.
  • Net bad loans reduced to 0.57% as of September-end, down from 0.62% in March.
  • Asset quality among non-bank finance companies (NBFCs) has also improved.
  • The RBI has urged the financial sector to be cautious and avoid excessive exuberance.
  • Banks are advised to bolster their risk management and IT governance.
The RBI emphasized the importance of avoiding usurious interest rates and strengthening customer grievance mechanisms.

The robust performance of Indian banks indicates a positive trend in the financial sector, emphasizing the need for continued vigilance and management to maintain this momentum.
newTitle: Indian Banks Report Robust Balance Sheets and Declining Bad Loans

title: Microsoft is forcing its AI assistant on people—and making them pay | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Microsoft is forcing its AI assistant on people—and making them pay

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Company Business News

Microsoft is introducing its AI assistant, Copilot, to customers who may not want it, along with an increase in subscription fees for its Microsoft 365 services in certain regions.

  • Copilot is now part of the Microsoft 365 subscription in Australia and Southeast Asia.
  • Microsoft has raised prices for users of the subscription service as part of this rollout.
  • This move is part of Microsoft's strategy to boost excitement for its AI products.
“Microsoft is trying a new approach to build excitement for its artificial-intelligence assistant Copilot: Give it to customers whether they want it or not.”

This approach may raise concerns among consumers regarding privacy and the viability of forced upgrades.
newTitle: Microsoft Forces AI Assistant Copilot on Users Amid Price Hike

Indian benchmark indices traded in a narrow range, with the S&P BSE Sensex closing slightly down and the Nifty showing minor gains. Analysts indicate a prevailing cautious sentiment among investors as they await new market triggers.

Elon Musk responds to tech CEO who asked if foreign-born workers are really taking jobs away from America - The Times of India
summary:
Elon Musk responds to tech CEO who asked if foreign-born workers are really taking jobs away from Americans

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

In a recent discussion, Elon Musk addressed concerns raised by a tech CEO regarding the impact of foreign-born workers on American jobs, emphasizing the need for a balanced perspective.

  • Musk highlighted the contributions of foreign-born workers to innovation and growth within the tech industry.
  • The debate on job loss versus job creation due to foreign talent has been ongoing in various sectors.
  • Musk argued that diverse talent can lead to more opportunities rather than diminished prospects for American workers.
“Innovation thrives in diversity—foreign talent has often been a catalyst for progress,” Musk stated.

This discussion underscores the complexity of the job market and the vital role that foreign-born professionals play in shaping the economy.
newTitle: Elon Musk's Insight on Foreign-Born Workers and Job Market Debate

title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO: From key dates to risks — here are 10 things to know from RHP | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO: From key dates to risks — here are 10 things to know from RHP

Publication Date: December 30, 2023 Source: Live Mint

The Chandigarh-based farm equipment manufacturer Indo Farm Equipment is set to launch its initial public offering (IPO) next week within a price band of ₹204 to ₹215 per share, aiming to raise ₹260.15 crore.

  • Key Dates: IPO opens on December 31, 2023, and closes on January 2, 2024.
  • IPO Structure: Fresh issue of 86 lakh equity shares and an OFS of 35 lakh shares.
  • Financial Objectives: ₹50 crore for debt repayment, ₹70.07 crore for crane manufacturing capacity expansion, and ₹45 crore for its NBFC subsidiary.
  • Key Risks: Potential reduction of demand and other operational challenges.
  • Company Overview: The company derives most revenue from its tractor segments.
“The overall growth of the company in the last three financial years has been low, with profit margins increasing marginally.”

This IPO presents an opportunity for investors to engage with a growing sector, albeit with notable risks surrounding demand and manufacturing challenges.
newTitle: Key Details and Risks of Indo Farm Equipment IPO

summary:
Fixed Deposit Interest Rates Across Banks: See List of Rates Up to 7.4%

Date: Dec 26, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

This article discusses the current interest rates offered by various banks for fixed deposits (FDs) in India, highlighting the benefits of FDs and the rates available for different banks.

Key Points:

  • Interest rates on FDs range from 6.80% to 7.40% depending on the bank.
  • DCB Bank offers the highest rate at 7.40% for a tenure of five years.
  • Interest rates on FDs are not influenced by stock market volatility.
  • Senior citizens may receive higher interest rates compared to regular citizens.
  • Penalty structures exist for premature withdrawal of FDs, varying by amount and duration.
“No penalty for premature payment will be levied in case of premature payment of deposits up to ₹5 lacs provided it remained with the bank for a minimum period of 12 months.” - Bank of Baroda

The fixed deposit interest rates provide a secure option for individuals looking to grow their savings with guaranteed returns, with favorable rates currently available across several banks.

Unimech Aerospace IPO Day 3 Live Updates

Date: 26 Dec, 2024

Source: LiveMint

The Unimech Aerospace and Manufacturing Ltd. IPO has garnered significant interest, marking a subscription rate of 172.13x as it concludes on December 26, 2024. The price range for shares is set between ₹745-785, with an issue total of up to ₹500 crore.

  • The IPO was subscribed 9.09 times on the second day, with strong backing from both Non-Institutional Investors (NIIs) and Retail Individual Investors (RIIs).
  • As of Day 3, the issue reached a subscription level of 173.68 times, with various investor categories subscribing significantly: QIBs at 317.63x, NIIs at 262.45x, retail at 54.07x, and employees at 92.61x.
  • The company has made a notable name in high-precision engineering solutions, serving industries including aerospace, defense, and energy.
“At the upper end of its price range, UAML is demanding a P/E multiple of 68.7x, based on its FY24 EPS of ₹11.4...” - Choice Equity Broking

The strong market response showcases investor confidence in Unimech's growth potential and its established role in a sector with significant barriers to entry.

title: Explained - What caused the 5% surge in Adani Ports shares on Thursday - CNBCTV18
summary:
Explained - What caused the 5% surge in Adani Ports shares on Thursday

Publication Date: December 26, 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

The shares of Adani Ports surged by 5.5% recently, buoyed by significant developments at the Vizhinjam port.

  • The MSC Michela, the 100th commercial vessel, docked at Kerala's Vizhinjam port.
  • This milestone comes less than six months after the port's opening.
  • The port showcases advanced technology in container handling, positioning India as a global transshipment hub.
  • Kerala CM announced further investment and expansion of the port's capacity.
  • Adani Ports shares are trading at ₹1,242.4, maintaining positive returns over five consecutive years.
“The arrival of MSC Michela... is another milestone in India's rapid emergence as a global transshipment hub.” — Karan Adani

This surge highlights the strategic importance of the Vizhinjam port and its projected growth, making Adani Ports an attractive investment opportunity.
newTitle: Surge in Adani Ports Shares Explained

title: International Gemmological shares soar 10% on acquisition of 2 companies - The Economic Times
summary:
International Gemmological Shares Rise 10% After Acquiring Two Companies

Publication Date: Thursday, Article Source: Economic Times

Shares of the newly-listed International Gemmological Institute soared 10% on Thursday, reaching a new high of Rs 580.45 on the BSE due to the acquisition of IGI Netherlands and International Gemmological Institute BV.

  • The company acquired a 100% stake in IGI Netherlands B.V. for USD 88,440,543 and International Gemmological Institute BV for USD 69,761,445.
  • Post-acquisition, both companies are now wholly-owned subsidiaries of the International Gemmological Institute.
  • The primary business of IGI Netherlands includes certification and accreditation of diamonds and jewelry, while International Gemmological Institute BV specializes in diamond screening and detection services.
  • The shares were listed with a significant premium on NSE and BSE, with an IPO subscription rate of 35 times.
“The acquisition was done for the purpose of expansion of core business in an important market.”

This acquisition positions the International Gemmological Institute for significant growth in the diamond certification industry.
newTitle: International Gemmological Shares Rise 10% After Acquiring Two Companies
